column4: hello, i installed some programs but they arn't showing up in the applications menu - were do i find them? Specifically Wine?
thanks
try running wineboot.. don't know what it does exactly.. but sometimes it makes shortcuts turn up
otherwise you're wine stuff is usually located in /usr/home/yourusername/.wine/drive_c  or something along those lines
it's a terminal command that comes with wine.. try running it in the terminal, when you don't have any wine apps running
wineboot.. no space.
that sounds right.. but check your applications menu now.. anything new in there?
i couldn't see anything new there
hmm..  well.. then you'll just have to find it yourself.. go to a terminal and type "cd ~/.wine" without the quotes
then tell me what folders you see when you type "ls"
you got that when you type "ls"?
no folders? just those files?
yeah after i typed: cd ~/.wine
hmm.. odd..  run this then "wineprefixcreate"
and then try ls again
i now get: wine updated successfully.
ok.. try "ls" again.. you should have at least one folder in there.. mine is named drive_c
i get: dosdevices  drive_c  system.reg  userdef.reg  user.reg
ahh.. there it is.. drive_c is the folder I was looking for.. in there are all the files that in a windows-installation is on drive c
in there you'll find you "program files" "windows" etc.. also.. all windows programs you install using wine will end up in there
Ok does that mean that i have to go to drive c to access those programs?

my windows programs end up in a wine-menu under the applications menu.. I don't know if it will do that for you.. if it doesn't you'll have to search for the executable file in that folder (drive_c) and run it manually
you're welcome
